For right now I would think about finding solutions to save the quality of the water. There may be things that could help. I am not a scientist, but I do have smaller scale filtration experience. I wonder if it would be helpful to pump the water with the bad bacteria through tankers (truck or train) filed with charcoal.  I would think that since this major issue recurs that water filtration stations should be built to reach the deepest parts of the water where the bacteria issue occurs. As water levels go down in the future, the filtration would be more effective because there would be much less to filter. Good bacteria keeps bad bacteria at bay. I know that is a lot of water, but life and commerce depend on the water supply and any filtration is an improvement over no filtration. I also wonder if there is a plant or anything that can be introduced to these waters that would use and cycle the bad bacteria.
